classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Area D Elective, E, and F. Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any Life Science Support Elective course can go here. Cannot double count units.

Select 4 units from the following "Life Science" Support Electives: BIO111, BIO161, BIO213 & BMED213; BOT121; MCRO221.
Choose one of the following: MATH206, or MATH244.

Any Additional Science Support Elective course can go here. Cannot doubt count units.

Select 4 units from the following "Additional Science" Support Electives: BIO111, BIO161; BOT121; CHEM124; MCRO221; MCRO221, MCRO224; PHYS141.
Choose one of the following: PHIL230, or PHIL231.
Choose one of the following: CSC300, or PHIl323.
Choose one of the following: WGS/ES 350, or WGS/ES 351.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequsites.
